aircraft.value: Wasp Interceptor - AC-3143-367 at Sector East Station

defect_observed.value: Brake system pressure decay. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.

root_cause.value: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Steering Control component. Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.

corrective_action.value: Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps

remarks_investigation.value: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.

remarks_design.value: Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions. Date: 28/06/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. T.R. Menon

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit. Date: 30/06/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations. Date: 30/06/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable. Date: 02/07/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions. Date: 08/07/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Brake system pressure decay. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Steering Control component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Establish periodic calibration schedule
d) Attributable Code: U - Lapses on the part of User
